sequence:
Émile, the Dancing Angel

<size=45>Chapter 7 - Émile's Romance Theory Pt. 2</size>

scripts.say: Romance shouldn't be an act for the public to see, I believe it should be a feeling you convey to your partner.
You may not have thought about it before, Commander, but just as a few examples:
Whether you're quietly admiring my dancing, letting me do the things I want to, or enjoying dessert with me...
Émile smiled and grabbed hold of my hand with both of hers.
... All those things are what I consider to be romantic♪
But if you aren't doing them specifically for your partner, then they're nothing more than shallow gestures, no matter how romantic you think they are...
When your actions are with your partner in mind and you're doing what they want, your feelings will unquestionably reach them.
... I am so happy that I met a romantic who's just like that.
I am so happy that I met you, Commander.
I could feel the strong sense of affection and romance behind Émile's words.
That feeling you get when you understand your partner, make them happy, and know what it is you want to tell them...
I believe... no, I KNOW this is the feeling known as "love"!
... I don't know why, but suddenly I feel like dancing♪
Letting go with one hand, Émile guided herself towards me with her other, taking light steps before coming to a stop.
Normally, I dance pas seul – but this time, I'd like to dance pas de deux...
... Will you dance with me, Commander?
